meanings.definition: To perform better or achieve more than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to overachieve in her schoolwork.
meanings.sent2: He managed to overachieve in his job by completing all tasks ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The little ant decided to overachieve by carrying a huge crumb back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: The team's determination to overachieve was like a bright beacon of success.
meanings.sent5: The student's drive to overachieve shone through in every project.

meanings.definition: To excel or succeed beyond what is considered normal or usual.
meanings.sent1: The athlete continued to overachieve in every competition.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overachieve in everything she sets her mind to.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to overachieve by gathering an entire winter's worth of nuts in one day.
meanings.sent4: His determination to overachieve was like a powerful engine propelling him forward.
meanings.sent5: The company's ability to overachieve set them apart from their competitors.
